text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with beef brisket cherry tomato
sauce that's right a delicious rich
beefy meat sauce kind of brightened up
and freshened up a little bit with some
cherry tomatoes so here's what we did I
had about a two-pound piece of brisket
that I cut in chunks I also had about I
don't know half a pound of boneless beef
short rib that I threw in here so really
about two and a half pounds of any kind
of stewing beef now what I did is I
threw it in my Dutch oven with just like
a tablespoon of olive oil and most of
these recipes are going to say brown
over high heat in small batches which
takes like forever and works but this
also works throw all the meat in pinch
of salt high heat like I said a little
bit of oil and what's going to happen
all the juice is going to come out it's
going to evaporate the oil doesn't
evaporate that stays in the pot the beef
now coated with that sticky meat juice
starts caramelizing in the oil and you
get beautiful browned chunks of beef
which make a nice sauce so if you want
to Brown in small batches like the
cookbook says go ahead but I like this
method for this kind of a sauce this is
going to braise forever okay so once
it's brown we're going to add a quart of
chicken stock you can use water you can
use vegetable stock don't use beef broth
why I just trust me I don't have time to
explain all right we're going to throw
in a bay leaf and just a little pinch of
dried rosemary maybe a quarter of a
teaspoon and that's going to really be
it for seasoning for now I'm going to
bring that to a simmer turn it to low
and just let it sit there while I prep
my beautiful cherry tomatoes I'm using
sweet 100 those are the red ones I'm
using sungold
those are the gold ones super super
sweet but also a little bit sour a
little bit bitter very fragrant does
amazing things I'm gonna throw this in a
blender with some olive oil some
shallots and some garlic and I'm gonna
blend that to a very very smooth puree
so that cherry tomato with the shallot
and the garlic is going to make kind of
a beautiful fresh vegetable juice almost
it's going to just give it so much fresh
flavor and by the way we're going to get
a different flavor profile from the raw
garlic and shallot pureed with the
tomato then we would have if we had
sauteed it with
the meat at the beginning which would
have been a more traditional and then
just to stay in shape a couple
tablespoons of tomato paste because the
cherry tomatoes don't really have a lot
of body all right bring that back up to
a simmer put the lid on and let this
braise on low for two-and-a-half hours
now you thought it was on low when you
were simmering your beef just now all
right but I mean low like yes that low
all right two and a half hours later
you're like it's got to be cooked
no brisket takes forever that's why it's
so delicious so much connective tissue
so at this point we're going to uncover
it cook it another hour uncovered which
is going to thicken it up a little
because now the water vapors are
evaporating all right so it's cooked
uncovered for an hour at that point
we're going to add three and a half or
so cups of tomato sauce that's basically
one jar I had some tomato sauce on hand
I had made earlier but you can use a jar
no problem you're cooking everything
else from scratch it's okay don't feel
bad all right optional here I'm going to
put in a little splash of heavy cream
that gives it a little richness I think
I heard Alton Brown one time say
something in the milk helps break down
the meat but I could have totally dreamt
that and also it does give it an
incredibly cool beautiful color now the
rest of this recipe is so easy simply
simmer this on low uncovered until the
meat is tender and falling apart
you can swish it with your spoon to
break it into tiny pieces you could
leave it in little tender chunks up to
you your sauce of course you're going to
want to taste and adjust the seasoning
salt freshly ground black pepper
beautiful chili flakes of course Cayenne
do you even have to ask now as far as
pasta shape I decided to boil some penne
pasta which I think works perfectly this
would be awesome on rigatoni and of
course some freshly grated Reggiano on
top that is a magnificent meat sauce by
the way if you don't know how to finish
a pasta recipe go watch some of our
other videos you don't ladle the sauce
over regular plain pasta you got to meld
it together alright so there's a
technique so go check out some of the
other videos for that and this was like
I said amazing the tender beefy super
flavorful brisket the brightness the
freshness of the cherry tomato alright
just worked beautiful
I have to preface that by saying I'm a
huge fan of my cooking but even so I
thought this came out really well I
really hope you go find some beef
brisket and cherry tomatoes and give it
a try so go check out the site all the
ingredients are there and as always
enjoy
